title: Trip Budget Planner
description: Plan trip budgets with daily expenses, fixed costs, and currency exchange buffers. Calculate total trip costs in home and local currency with safety margins for international travel.

sections.title: What This Tool Does
content: Daily Expense Calculator: Estimate daily costs for fuel, lodging, meals, activities, and miscellaneous expenses.
Fixed Cost Tracker: Add pre-paid expenses like flights, insurance, visas, and gear purchases.
Currency Converter: Calculate costs in both home and destination currency with current exchange rates.
Safety Buffer: Add a percentage buffer for unexpected expenses, currency fluctuations, and emergencies.

sections.title: When to Use This Tool
content: International Travel: Plan budgets for trips abroad with currency conversion and exchange rate buffers.
Road Trips: Estimate fuel, lodging, and food costs for multi-day driving adventures.
Backpacking Trips: Budget for hostels, meals, activities, and transportation across multiple destinations.
Business Travel: Calculate per diem estimates and total trip costs for expense planning.
Digital Nomad Planning: Estimate monthly living costs in different countries with currency considerations.

sections.title: How to Use
content: Step 1: Enter the number of days for your trip.
Step 2: Input daily expenses: fuel/transport, lodging, meals, activities, and miscellaneous.
Step 3: Add fixed costs like flights, insurance, visas, or gear.
Step 4 (optional): Enter exchange rate (local currency per 1 unit of home currency).
Step 5: Set a buffer percentage (10-20% recommended for international trips).
Step 6: Review totals in both currencies with category breakdown.

sections.title: Budget Categories Explained
content: Fuel/Transport: Gas, public transit, rideshares, car rentals, or fuel for your own vehicle.
Lodging: Hotels, hostels, Airbnb, camping fees, or any accommodation costs.
Meals: Restaurants, groceries, street food, and beverages.
Activities: Tours, entrance fees, equipment rentals, events, and entertainment.
Miscellaneous: Souvenirs, laundry, phone data, tips, and unexpected small expenses.
Fixed Costs: Pre-trip expenses like flights, travel insurance, visas, vaccinations, and new gear.

sections.title: Currency Buffer Guidelines
content: 5-10% Buffer: Stable currencies, developed countries, short trips.
10-15% Buffer: Moderate volatility currencies, medium-length trips.
15-25% Buffer: High volatility currencies, developing countries, long trips.
Why Buffer Matters: Exchange rates fluctuate daily. A buffer protects against unfavorable changes and gives you spending flexibility.

sections.title: Tips for Accurate Budgeting
content: ✓ Research Destination Costs: Use travel blogs, Numbeo, or government travel advisories for realistic daily cost estimates.
✓ Track Past Trips: Your actual spending history is the best predictor for future trips.
✓ Plan for Regional Variation: Cities cost more than rural areas. Adjust daily budgets if traveling through multiple regions.
✓ Include Travel Days: Transit days still cost money for food and transport—count them in your total days.
✓ Emergency Fund: Keep a separate emergency fund beyond your budget buffer for serious unexpected events.

sections.title: Common Budgeting Mistakes
content: Underestimating Daily Costs: Research shows most travelers underestimate by 20-30%. Add a buffer to your initial estimates.
Forgetting Fixed Costs: Flights and insurance can double your trip cost. Always include pre-trip expenses.
Ignoring Currency Exchange Fees: Banks charge 2-4% for foreign transactions. Factor this into your exchange rate.
No Buffer for Emergencies: Medical issues, missed connections, or lost items cost money. Always have a 10-20% buffer.
Assuming Constant Daily Spending: Some days you'll splurge, others you'll save. Average it out but plan for high-spend days.

sections.title: Example Budgets
content: Southeast Asia (14 days): $40/day (lodging $15, meals $15, activities $5, misc $5) + $800 flights = $1,360 base + 15% buffer = $1,564 total.
European Road Trip (10 days): $120/day (fuel $30, lodging $50, meals $30, misc $10) + $200 fixed = $1,400 base + 10% buffer = $1,540 total.
US National Parks (7 days): $85/day (fuel $25, lodging $40, meals $15, activities $5) + $150 fixed = $745 base + 10% buffer = $819 total.
